content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    new_words = Vector{String}()
    for word in words
        if word[1] == uppercase(word[1])
            push!(new_words, word)
        end
    end
    return new_words
end
```

This function takes a vector of strings (`words`) and returns a new vector containing only the words that start with an uppercase letter. It works by iterating over each word in the input list, checking whether its first character is equal to its uppercase version (using `uppercase`). If so, it adds the word to the output vector; otherwise, it skips it.
